conversation.content: I know you're, um, hurting so much right now and, well, I just [very sad] wish I could, you know, take some of that pain away.
You can't fix this for me, nobody can, it's like, the thing is, my whole life got ripped apart and, er, I don't even know where to start rebuilding.
You don't have to rebuild everything at once, just surviving each day is enough.
But I'm not even doing that, I mean, I'm barely [excited] existing here, honestly, just going through motions while, you know, feeling completely dead inside.
That numbness is your mind protecting you from feeling too much at once.
Protection? This feels more like, um, drowning in slow motion where, actually, every breath takes effort and, well, nothing seems worth the energy anymore.
Have you been eating at all? I could bring you some soup.
Food tastes like cardboard and I can't [cry loudly] keep anything down anyway because my stomach is constantly in knots from missing them so much.
Your body still needs nourishment even when your heart is broken.
I know that logically but my brain keeps [frustrated] telling me that taking care of myself is pointless when the person I love doesn't want me anymore.
Hey, listen, I mean, you still matter even if, umm, they couldn't see your worth, honestly.
Their opinion shouldn't define me but it does, and I hate myself for still caring what they think after everything that happened between us.
It's okay to still care, feelings don't just disappear because someone hurt you.
But I want them to disappear, like, desperately need them gone because, actually, carrying this love for someone who left is, er, absolutely excruciating.
I understand that, well, completely, and it's, you know, so unfair that, uhh, hearts don't come with off switches.
Sometimes I think about, hmm, just packing everything and starting over somewhere new where, basically, nothing reminds me of what we had, you know?
Would a fresh start somewhere else really help you heal?
Probably not because the memories would follow me anyway, but at least I wouldn't have to see our favorite coffee shop or the park bench where we first kissed.
Those places were special but they're [furious] not worth destroying yourself over, and you deserve so much better than this suffering.
I know you're right but, well, accepting that means, sort of, admitting it's really over and, honestly, I'm not ready for that finality yet.
